item.title: Overgrown weed Kirkham Street/Swingate Lane, 9th August
item.description:
There is a significant growth of weeds along the edge of the pavement next to the brick wall and metal railings outside of the flats on Kirkham Street/ Swingate lane. The weeds are growing between the pavement slabs and the wall, and in some places are quite overgrown. This could become a trip hazard for pedestrians and affects the appearance of the area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kirkham Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Exsessive rubbish all along Elmfield Road, 9th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Elmfield Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous barbed wire and crumbling wall on residential road, 9th August
item.description:
This property has low-down barbed wire which contravenes Section 164 of the Highways Act 1980, â€œbarbed wire or razor wire located within 2.4 metres of highways is considered a nuisance and potential risk and local authorities can issue notices for it to be removed". It is about 1.5 metres from the road, next to a pavement. Some sections of it are sticking out and could injure a member of the public. (Ref: https://www.rollerbarrier.com/blogs/anti-climb/is-it-legal-to-use-barbed-wire-or-razor-fencing.) Highways Act 1980: Power to require removal of barbed wire. (Ref: https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1980/66/section/164)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Lane, Hornsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic sign not visible, 9th August
item.description:
When the illuminated bollard on the traffic island outside Sainsbury's Local on Beckenham Road was replaced recently it was put back the wrong way round. This means that oncoming traffic from the direction of Beckenham can't see the "keep left" blue arrow warning it to avoid the island.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidney Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van hasn't moved for 5 days and night with multiple long ladders with overhangs. Accident waiting to happen, 9th August
item.description:
Many ladders on top this van not very secure ,it's dangerous. could be fatal as many deliveries on motor bikes come here as there is overhang of the ladders plus the ladders could be used to get in to the 1st floor apartments of the building. It's summer we sleep with our windows slightly open. Please get it removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, 33A, Southwick Street, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: PK59 XAS - Vehicle Parked with Ladder, 9th August
item.description:
Registration number PK59 XAS parked outside 29/31 Southwick Street London W2 1JQ since 5th August. The ladder is a cause of concern to residents as this will encourage opportunists to use the ladder to break in to properties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, 33A, Southwick Street, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bad smell, 9th August
item.description:
There is a bad smell coming from 37 Spenser Grove. It smells like something is rotting in there. Rubbish or a body or sewage. Tenant not seen for months. The smell has been around for about 10 days now.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Spenser Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
